intro: Sida stipularis, commonly known as the stipular sida, is a flowering plant species belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly in Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often hairy and have distinctive stipules. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and its fruits are capsules that release seeds when mature. Sida stipularis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and open fields.
